intro: Alstroemeria discolor, commonly known as the pink-flowered alstroemeria, is a perennial herb native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with grass-like, strap-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soil. Alstroemeria discolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
